item.title: How Maestro Smart Antenna Improves Fixed Wireless
item.description:
Accel Technologies, a branch of Accel Networks, is launching a groundbreaking product for fixed wireless connections: the Maestro smart antenna system. Maestro aims to make 3G and 4G fixed wireless broadband a more attractive alternative to pricier business connectivity options like T1, MPLS, VSAT, Frame Relay, and point-to-point microwave services. What makes Maestro so special? Like other smart devices, Maestro utilizes active technology to enhance performance. In this situation, it improves the performance of a typically passive component: the RF antenna...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/how-maestro-smart-antenna-improves-fixed-wireless/

item.title: Wireless Internet Access For Farms
item.description:
While living and working on a farm has its perks, getting reliable broadband internet can be a challenge. Conventional options like DSL and Cable might not be feasible due to distance limitations, often leaving farms outside their service areas. Don’t worry, there are other solutions for obtaining reasonably priced internet access in rural areas. These alternatives focus on services that overcome distance barriers or eliminate the need for physical cables...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/wireless-internet-access-for-farms/

item.title: Fixed Wireless For Rural Retail
item.description:
Small businesses outside of cities often struggle to obtain affordable and reliable broadband. While some resort to satellite or T1 lines for internet and point-of-sale systems, others have discovered that 3G wireless offers a secure and cost-effective alternative for credit card processing.
](http://www.sheepfort1.com/usa/FixedWireless/fixed-wireless-broadband.php)
We associate 3G with mobile phones and laptops, but a lesser-known application exists. This service combines the widespread availability of 3G signals with powerful multi-carrier equipment and a secure VPN network, making it suitable for business needs...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/fixed-wireless-for-rural-retail/

item.title: Fixed Wireless Moving To 4G
item.description:
Fixed wireless broadband for businesses has two main forms. The first, found primarily in downtown areas of major cities, uses licensed microwave services. While this method offers high bandwidth, it has a limited coverage area of a few thousand feet and requires a clear line of sight. The second approach utilizes existing 3G cellular broadband networks to provide wider coverage, comparable to a T1 line’s bandwidth, wherever there’s a cell phone signal...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/fixed-wireless-moving-to-4g/
